results.name: Smallest odd prime factor of 3^n - 1.
comment: Levi Ben Gerson (1288-1344) proved that 3^n - 1 = 2^m has no solution in integers if n > 2, by showing that 3^n - l has an odd prime factor. His proof uses remainders after division of powers of 3 by 8 and powers of 2 by 8; see the Lenstra and Peterson links. For an elegant short proof, see the Franklin link. - Sondow

One way to prove it is by the use of congruences. The powers of 3, modulo 80, are 3, 9, 27, 1, 3, 9, 27, 1, 3, 9, 27, 1, ... The powers of 2 are 2, 4, 8, 16, 32, 64, 48, 16, 32, 64, 48, 16, ... - _Alonso del Arte_, Jan 20 2014
reference: L. E. Dickson, History of the Theory of Numbers, Vol. II, Chelsea, NY 1992; see p. 731.
